common

Class ImageRandomAccessWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.ImageRandomAccessReader
      • common.ImageRandomAccessWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteStreamReader, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ImageRandomAccessWriter
extends ImageRandomAccessReader
    A seekable binary stream writer backed by RandomAccessFile.

    Extends the reader to provide in-place file modification capabilities. Supports writing primitive types with configurable byte order, concerning the endian-ness. This is particularly useful for surgical metadata patching where only specific segments of an image file need to be updated.

    Since:
    3 February 2026
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] bytes,
                       int length)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an array of bytes, ensuring the file pointer advances by exactly the specified length.

        If the input array is shorter than length, it is padded with trailing zeros (0x00). If the input array is longer than length, only the first length bytes are written.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the data to write (may be null, treated as all zeros)
        length - the exact number of bytes to occupy in the file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the stream is read-only or an I/O error occurs

      • writeInteger

        public void writeUnsignedInteger24(int value)
